And... the system map?

6 minutes ago, theogameren said:

And... the system map?

There are already system maps on the OP for all four, you can see all the orbits. If you're referring to Elite:Dangerous style maps or other artistic representations that would also come in the future when the mods are more stable and less likely to drastically change between updates.
I've put in a small idea in the suggestion box, maybe for OPXComets+ you could put in the interstellar objects 'Oumuamua and Borisov on very eccentric trajectories?

19 hours ago, The Minmus Derp said:

OPX-SarnusPlus v0.3.0 "Beast"

  • Eightfold increase in Sarnus' gravity
  • Radius increase to 6991 km

Well, that might complicate things for my en-route Sarnus probe a little... (It's a neat change, I do like the idea.)

Looking forward to the updates overall. Suppose it will be quite some time before I have enough info (especially surface sample sciencedefs) to do more RationalResources PRs. Let me know whether you even want me submitting those; the Neidon one hasn't been touched and that makes enough sense given how low-priority all this stuff is (and, presumably, your own knowledge of body compositions and so on).

Edited Sunday at 12:54 AM by arbsoup

37 minutes ago, arbsoup said:

Well, that might complicate things for my en-route Sarnus probe a little... (It's a neat change, I do like the idea.)

Looking forward to the updates overall. Suppose it will be quite some time before I have enough info (especially surface sample sciencedefs) to do more RationalResources PRs. Let me know whether you even want me submitting those; the Neidon one hasn't been touched and that makes enough sense given how low-priority all this stuff is (and, presumably, your own knowledge of body compositions and so on).

Gotta be fully honest compatibility patches for stuff like that are not high priority right now. I'll get to it after bigger stuff like "Now OPM Isnt Required Anymore" and "I Added Four More Asteroids" is taken care of, but I will get to it. RR is the kind of thing that would be added after a stable 1.0 release happens, and I don't even have CRP yet lol

UPDATE: JoolPlus seems to require a hotfix since Klip broke sometime between now and the last time I tested it, and it forgot what "texture" means. if this happens again I'm jumping into lake superior

EDIT: I actually fixed the above problem! JoolPlus hotfix will be dropped soon. UrlumPlus hotfix already has. 

Edited Sunday at 03:20 AM by The Minmus Derp
bruh

4 minutes ago, The Minmus Derp said:

Please see: Joke

For extra information on this subject please view: Joke (Wikipedia)
Oh .

OPX-StockSystemModifications has been released! It's by far the smallest installment of OPX so far and probably forever, because it only comes with like four textures to make the Sun look good. The ordering is off from my list of future plans, because it turned out to be surprisingly easy to fix the remaining problems with it. It's also a little more settings-heavy than the others, as moving so much of the inner system around naturally requires a lot of toggles for people using this in an existing save. Let me know what you think! I'm currently editing the OP to add it properly.

A little announcement about compatibilities regarding OPX-SSM:

Techo's Planet Revamp is, at least for now, NOT COMPATIBLE with OPX-SSM or OPX-JoolPlus. The weird thing the mod does where it deletes and replaces all the planets even the ones it hasnt modified yet completely bricks the Jool System and undoes all my changes to the inner system orbits. I will endeavor to make it compatible although I do not personally play with it, but for now do not under any circumstances install either mod with TPR, especially JoolPlus.

The Kerbol Realism Patch, for unknown reasons likely related to the radius of the star, breaks volumetric clouds. Why? No idea. I'm not the gal who writes that. But for now it would be best to disable the KRP if you play with volumetric clouds to make it not look awful. In the future I will add the sun texture by default and restrict the setting to just the radius change so you can keep the epic sunspots.

TL;DR dont install TPR and JoolPlus/SSM at the same time, dont use the KRP with volumetric clouds
nice information, but i don't have the energy to buy Vol. Clouds.
